data.message: CONGRATULATIONS! You have all completed the 90 days of posts in this group! Thank you to all of you for your participation and openmindedness - you really helped us out. Please check your email in the next few days to fill out the first follow up survey. Completing this will get you a $20 gift card!I will be finalizing your numbers for how many comments each of you had, and I will make sure you all get your incentive money as soon as possible. Thanks everyone!-Victoria from TSP
90.  All federal buildings, many state and local government buildings, and even some parks, beaches and playgrounds are now smoke-free. What do you think of these laws? #smokingaffectsall
I think it's good for them to be smoke free so that our decisions don't effect other people that gather there.
There should be designated smoking areas everywhere because people are still gonna smoke.

89.  Instead of allowing the health warnings about smoking to go through one ear and out the other, let them sink in: COPD, lung disease, oral cancers, cataracts, the list goes on and on. Tell us, how often do you think about these diseases when you smoke? #beingconscious
Never. I don't think about diease in general.
I think about them every time I light up. I'm pretty paranoid.

88.  Research shows that one of the biggest triggers for smoking is stress. Familiarizing yourself with breathing techniques could help you relax without lighting up. Try this today when you feel stressed. Did it work? #feelinghealthy
I do this to help sleep but I start at the feet.
I'll give it a shot
With the 90 days being almost over I am curious to hear about your experience: What is the most important thing you have learned from TSP? #TDII

I didn't really learn much, but the thing that stuck the most with me was the post about the woman with mouth cancer. If anything made me legitimately want to quit smoking, it's that. the financial aspect hurts too but it was never a secret that I blow a lot of money on cigarettes.

87.  Ever wonder how much money you’ve spent on all your cigarettes? Use this Cost Calculator to see exactly how much you’ve spent and tell us what you would do with that money if you could get it back. #reflection http://buff.ly/1Lfmcih
data.name: www.quitterscircle.com
data.caption: www.quitterscircle.com

data.message: I would have saved like $11,000 ish. I probably would have spent it on pizza, lipstick, and shoes.

A lot more than that chart because cigarettes are two more dollars per pack here and the chart only goes to 5 years and I've been smoking longer than that. But around $30k I guess. Maybe I'd own a house now if I didnt smoke. Or maybe I would've blown it on makeup and beer.

86.  More and more states are raising the taxes on cigarettes. How does this make you feel as someone who smokes and how does it make you feel when you think of yourself as a nonsmoker? Post&Share your two different perspectives: #smokingaffectsall

I think it's getting rediculous. They're doing it to discourage people from smoking but if someone wants to smoke they're gonna anyways. And poor people smoke more due to stress and mental health issues so it's really just taxing poor people.
Yeah I don't really care either way.

data.message: 85.  When you think of yourself as someone who smokes, what words do you use to describe yourself? Pick one of these or add your own and tell us why that adjective fits your identity #livinghealthy • Strong-willed• Thoughtful• Inconsiderate• Determined
I don't know. Generally just as myself. With a cigarette
I'm just me, none of those fit me or have anything to do with the fact that I smoke.
84.  How do you feel about a medication that changes its dose of nicotine to match the intensity of your withdrawal symptoms? Would you consider using varenicline? #beingconscious
How does it work?
Like I said before, I don't like medications. They're almost always just as bad as tobacco.

83.  Check out this slide-show to see how smoking affects your physical appearance as well as some things you can do to combat those consequences. Click through the slides and let us know what you think! #reflection
data.name: Slideshow: Surprising Ways Affects Your Looks
data.caption: www.webmd.com
data.description: Pictures of twins show how smoking dramatically speeds up wrinkles and aging. Also covered: sagging breasts, early menopause, hair loss, cataracts, infertility, and other effects of smoking.

data.message: I notice with the twins that they did the makeup of the non-smoking one better and plucked her eyebrows compared to the other. I don't doubt twin 2 looks more aged because of smoking, but all those before/after twin 1/twin 2 stuff uses lighting and makeup tricks to make the side they want to look worse look bad.
I don't want to become ugly due to smoking but I think there are a lot of unhealthy things that can change your appearance to credit it all to Smoking is a bit of a stretch.

82.  Many states and public organizations are offering free smoking cessation programs online like www.trytostop.org and www.smokefree.gov. How do you feel about these free resources as a smoker, and how do you feel as a potential nonsmoker? #smokingaffectsall
I think that these are awesome things to offer people.
I think they're good resources for people but I don't think they'd do much for me.
81.  When you smoke, which one of these adjectives do you feel most often? If none of them fit you, add your own but be sure to share why! #livinghealthy • Controlled• In control• Restricted
In control. It helps with my panic attacks.
None of those. It's just something I do. It doesn't run my life.
80.  When you don’t have a lot of time to de-stress, using this Countdown Relaxation technique can be a real life-saver. Would you use this strategy to avoid smoking? #livinghealthy
I would give it a shot
Probably not
79.  What have you heard about bupropion to help people stop smoking? Would you consider taking a medication if it helped you to successfully quit smoking? #beingconscious
I'm actually on this for my bipolar disorder. It didn't help me quit.
I don't even take Tylenol if I can help it, so no.

78.  Ever notice the difference between the smokers in tobacco advertisements and the smokers you see in real life? Antonella did. Read her story and share with us anything you’ve noticed about Big Tobacco advertisements. #reflection
data.name: A Goodbye Letter to Cigarettes
data.caption: quitsmoking.about.com
data.description: Nicotine addiction is like a bad relationship. You know it's hurting you, but leaving it behind is tough. This goodbye letter was written by someone who found their way free of the destructive relationship...

data.message: Again, large corporations don't have morals. All ads by large corporations are made up lies that don't accurately represent thier customers. Big Tobacco is just doing what literally all corporations do.
Yeah I don't think there's much of a difference between big tobacco companies and any other big company that sells their souls to make money, even if it means hurting the consumer.
I know stopping smoking is not easy. How confident are you that you could quit smoking if you tried? #TDII

Idk if I'd call it a standard but I do think smoking is becoming more of a stigma than ever.
It's pretty normal to not smoke now as opposed to 20 years ago.
76.  How do you view yourself when you smoke? Choose one of our options (or add your own) and tell us what makes you feel that way: Irresponsible, Independent, Responsible, Addicted. #knowyourself
Smoking makes me feel like in in charge of myself and my life.
Addicted. I actually do want to give it up but I'm struggling.
75.  Meditation is a well-known relaxation technique that can be done anywhere - work, class, at home, ANYWHERE. Do you think this could help you avoid a cigarette? #livinghealthy
Maybe. I'd have to try it to be sure.
Probably
74.  Creating a positive association with not smoking can keep you on the straight and narrow. What small rewards could keep you motivated if you experience withdrawal while quitting? #eyesontheprize
Video games are a really good distraction.
Tootsie roll pops

73.  This over-the-counter Nicotine Replacement Therapy looks like cough drops and can help alleviate withdrawal symptoms during work or class. Would you be interested in trying this method? Why or why not? #beingconscious
No it sounds like it would taste gross
No, I have always hated those things.

Did you know that you can avoid almost all of the negative long-term health consequences of smoking if you quit before you are 30 years old? Does that change how you feel about smoking and quitting? #TDII
I've got to run guys - check out this study if you're interested http://www.nejm.org/doi/full/10.1056/NEJMsa1211128
Also check out these benefits of quitting:

72.  Liz writes about how her cravings may drive her nuts in the moment, but remembers that just because she wants to go back to smoking every now and then doesn’t mean her relapse is inevitable. After reading her letter, what are your thoughts on withdrawal symptoms? #reflection
data.name: I Will Survive! - A Goodbye Letter To Smoking
data.caption: quitsmoking.about.com
data.description: This letter from a forum member at About Smoking Cessation poignantly describes how nicotine addiction hurt other relationships in her life.

data.message: I've never really had any. I'd get a tad angry but that's about it.
I think that it'll be hard no matter what.

71.  Have you heard? The World Health Organization is pushing for all countries to ban indoor smoking in public places and workplaces to protect nonsmokers from second-hand smoke. Are you glad that your parents, siblings, or children may be protected from toxins with this new ban? #smokingaffectsall
Yea. Banning smoking indoors makes sense.
Yeah I would support the ban pretty much.
Yes. I don't think you should smoke inside or around non smokers.

It's just something I do.
Just something I do
It's just something I do.

Visual imagery never really helped me
It went well.
It went pretty well.
68.  One of the best ways to combat a nicotine craving is to keep your hands busy! How do you plan to keep your hands occupied when you get hit with a sudden urge to smoke? #beingconscious
I color a lot.
Idk clap lol
I've always used the snapping a rubber band method.

67.  Thoughts about smoking don’t just disappear when you decide to quit. Be ready when those thoughts hit. Choose one of the following strategies that might help you stay focused on quitting. Why would it work for you? #eyesontheprize • Get up and do something active• Find a healthy way to relax or deal with the stress in your life• Keep your hands busy• Think about something else!
Color. Play video games. Read.
Probably getting up and doing something active. If I stay idle I tend to think about smoking.
Find a healthy way to relax and deal with stress.
Quitting smoking may not be number one on your current priorities list. What would make quitting more important to you? #TDII

65. Here’s a story of James, a 22-year-old man who quit smoking after starting before he was even 15. Tell us if his Quit Letter inspired you to find new reasons to quit or to reach out to someone else close to you who is trying to do the same. #reflection
data.name: A Diagnosis of Cancer Helped James Quit For Good
data.caption: quitsmoking.about.com
data.description: A diagnosis of cancer at the age of 20 was the final straw that helped James decide to quit smoking for good.

data.message: Hey that's good for him. But these inspirational stories don't help me or many people I know.
It didn't really help me find new reasons, it's all the same reasons I already had.
It didn't really help me find any new reasons to quit.
66. When withdrawal symptoms are at their worst, a nasal spray can be a quick and convenient way to pack a punch to those cravings. Would you ever use a nicotine nasal spray? #beingconscious
No. Putting stuff up my nose freaks me out.
No. Never. Nope.
No. That just sounds like a terrible idea to me.

data.message: 64. Some states are now banning smoking in ALL public places. How do you feel about the public effort to discourage smoking? #smokingaffectsall
All public places seems extreme.
It seems a little ridiculous. It is LEGAL to smoke and if I'm not anywhere near another person then I should be able to smoke if I please.
If they ban smoking they should vehicles and factories and everything else that pumps harmful exhaust into the environment.

63. Remember the small steps towards quitting from a few weeks ago? Let’s try another! Choose one that you haven’t tried before, and tell us how it went. #freeyourself • Delay your first cigarette of the day by 10 minutes• Limit your smoking to one or two places only • Smoke fewer cigarettes each day• Quit smoking for 24 hours
I've already quit. Have had 3 cigarettes in like the past month-ish.
I could try limiting smoking to one or two places
Just try to smoke less each day

62. Imagine you’re an executive for a large tobacco company who's been asked by a child to present at her school on Career Day. What would you say about your company’s mission? What would you tell the kids about smoking? #knowyourself
I can't even imangine that. I'm so far from ever being an executive for any kind of large company I don't even know where to begin.
I wouldn't even be able to talk to children seriously about that man.
I don't think they would invite someone who worked for big tobacco,  but I would just talk about being a business person not selling tobacco.

61. Having a motivating and centering mantra that you can repeat to yourself when things get tough can be a HUGE help to deal with cravings. Think of your own mantra/phrase you could use when cravings hit hard, and post it here. #feelinghealthy
Me and my friend keep saying "feel the healthhh"
I don't know... "Stay away from the black lung" ??
Something along the lines of "you can do it"

60. Smoking can touch virtually everyone in your life. If you choose to quit smoking, how would the lives of the people closest to you change in response to your decision? What chain reaction would you set off? #smokingaffectsall
I don't think my quitting has affected anyone in my life
My boyfriend wouldn't be waiting on me to smoke, I would go outside less at work, but I don't think anyone around me would quit except maybe my dad.
I don't think it'd set off any chain reaction. No ones lives would change. People would be happy for me but nothing would be different.

59. It’s time to turn over a new leaf. Collect all the things in your house that remind you of smoking (lighters, matches, ashtrays, your stashed away emergency pack) and replace them with your list of reasons to quit. Take a before-and-after pic and post it here! #eyesontheprize

Hey TSP members! We apologize that yesterday's and today's post didn't get shared at our regular time. They're both posted now - please comment on both within the week to earn $$$! Let us know if you have any questions. Thanks :) -Shirley from TSP
I don't get how I'm supposed to post a before and after pic unless I post a picture of money or healthy lungs lol.
I already stopped smoking so all I've got is a ton of lighters
I don't really have any smoking stashes. I keep my cigarettes and ash tray in the garage, and can't get rid of them because my family also smokes there.
58. Make a list here of all your pros for quitting smoking. How many can you think of? #balance

Hey TSP members! We apologize that yesterday's and today's post didn't get shared at our regular time. They're both posted now - please comment on both within the week to earn $$$! Let us know if you have any questions. Thanks :) -Shirley from TSP
I can think of at least 10 reasons to quit. The only reason to keep smoking is cuz I like it lol.
Healthier, save money, don't smell like cigarettes anymore
I can breathe better, I don't worry about smoking a cigarette whenever I want one, I can think clearer.
I can think of at least 5 reasons.
How would you support a friend who wants to quit smoking? #TDII

data.message: 57.  Statistics show that the most successful smokers use a combination of Nicotine Replacement Therapy (like the patch or gum) with some type of counseling to quit, but young adults are the least likely to use NRT’s to quit. Would you ever consider using an NRT? What about counseling to help you quit? #beingconscious

I would use the NRT for sure. But I don't know about the counseling Part. Some people's schedule is busy enough, can be hard to find time for things like that. But I'm sure counseling has a positive affect. It definitely can't hurt

I don't know that I would want to try NRT. I feel like it's very easy to get more nicotine through NRT without meaning to (because it's not the same as smoking and people may use more of the replacement than if they were smoking because they're looking for the similar feelings they get from smoking).
I might consider it but it doesn't particularly interest me. I just don't like the idea of switching to a new addiction.
Eh I haven't had a cigarette in a while now without either of those so no
I would probably use the NRT, but would not use counseling.
I do not believe in an NRT and I would not use one. I would and will use an e cigarette.
I would prefer counseling...

56.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1spgtbBs79E&feature=plcp Take a look at Christine’s story and share your thoughts about how smoking has forever changed her life and the way she nourishes herself. #reflection
data.name: Christine - Feeding Tube
data.caption: www.youtube.com
data.description: Christine talks about what it's like to live with oral cancer, from eating through a tube to still having some hope. Watch her video and get to know her a li...

data.message: That's depressing. A harsh reality of the possible negative health effects caused by smoking. :( it made me sad.
That was scary and depressing. Those harsh reality things are all pretty terrifying.
Well...that just ruined my labor day family reunion..  all these smokers around, people I love.  . ..
These,type of smoking videos make you want to cringe, yet I will still pick up a cigarette, simply because these are over exaggerated and I don't think I will be a statistic.
Hits hard on the heart. Makes you wonder if we will have the same outcome in our own lives.
54.  Bars and restaurants across the country are banning smoking. Is it legal to smoke in restaurants or bars in your state? How does it affect you? #smokingaffectsall
No it's not legal. It just makes me either wait til I leave to smoke or step outside for a smoke. Not a big deal to me.
I don't like smoking inside anyways so it never really bothered me.
No its not legal to smoke inside restraunts here, only some bars, and that's the way it should be. I don't want to affect other people with my bad decisions.
It's illegal to smoke in restaurants here. You can smoke in some bars but most have banned iy
It's not banned but we have a city ordinance. State next to us is banned all together. And no it doesn't bother me but i also use cigarettes. A non smoker might disagree.
Restaurants don't permit smoking, but bars do. Most bars I go to have a non-smoking area which I like. Too much smoke in enclosed spaces can be rough on everyone.

Restaurants in Saint Louis, Missouri do not allow smoking at all inside but have designated areas outside for people to smoke, but only in select restaurants. Most bars allow smoking, some bars and grills fo not.
55.  Who are you a role model for? Siblings, children, nieces, nephews? How would their lives change if you decided to quit? #smokingaffectsall
I'm not really around kids much.
My nieces. But I don't use around them and i doubt they even know i smoke.
I don't really think of myself as a role model for anyone.
I'm never around kids....
I have two kids. I don't really think their lives would change much if I quit. Maybe have some extra money to save for them or spend on them.
My nephew. He wouldn't know, because I do not smoke in front of him.

I'm not a role model for anyone, I'm more of a motivation and inspiration for my friends and the people I am around. These individuals know I smoke and are totally comfortable with my smoking and/or non smoking for that matter.
53.  If you labeled yourself as a nonsmoker, how would your self-image change? How would you see yourself differently if you no longer smoked? #knowyourself
I guess if anything, I would see myself as stronger for overcoming smoking.
I would see myself as less dependent I guess?
I would feel a lot better about myself. And also healthier for the rest of my life. I would probably have a better self image
Slightly less poor
Healthier, obviously.  And perhaps use the money to buy healthier food
My self image would not change, but I would probably feel healthier internally and externally.
I would probably feel healthier and possibly less dependant, but smoking does not define who I am or how I feel about myself.
How does your smoking affect your loved ones, kids, or significant other? What do they think about your smoking? #TDII
It doesn't effect them very much. But if it did it would be mental. My family doesn't approve of smoking.
Thanks for sharing 10408 - why do their disapprove? What are their reasons?
I'm not sure exactly. But they just seem tp frown on it. They've never been up front about why.
I see 10408. Does their judgement influence how you feel about it at all?
Oh yes, for sure.
Ok, so switching gears a bit: How has it been for you this past week? Have you taken any additional steps towards quitting? If so who did they go?
It's been good. Haven't really taken any more steps towards quitting but am moving closer everyday it seems. They've went well though, cutting back was a good thing for me.
That's great to hear 10408! Where are you at now in terms of number of cigs/day?
Great! Any situations you found particularly challenging?
I've got to run. Talk to you next week.

52.  A private jet, glamorous jewelry, fancy nails, and of course an e-cigarette. How many ways do you see Blu trying to sell their product as something that will make you fancier, richer, and more sophisticated? Their master plan isn’t so under-the-radar!  #ecig
data.name: Trinkets & Trash

I see the ad and think it looks silly lol. Like is it really that necessary to pop her chest out like that? It's impractical. She looks uncomfortable.
There are a ton, especially the way they attempt to make her look successful.
They're essentially trying to advertise e-cigarettes in all the ways they used to market cigarettes.

When I'm bored. It's easy
Impatient, or need a break. I only want one when I'm bored if I'm outside
Stressed, need a break, boredom.
When I'm bored and sometimes when I'm watching tv if I see a character smoking.
When I'm bored is a big one for me.
When I'm bored or stressed.

I'll probably get cancer someday. It's in my family.
Cancer is one of my biggest fears. I know each time I light up a cigarette, imnincreasing my chances, yet I still feel like the odds of me even getting sick is slim to none.

Cancer in a big fear. I've never had it in my family though.
I worry about cancer often.

I don't smoke in my home and I only smoke in my car with other smokers.
I don't have a car and don't smoke in my home.
I used to smoke in my old apartment, so anyone who was there. I don't have a car.
My co workers that i work with. Because we can smoke inside at Work.
I smoke outside of my home and I smoke in my car. Both of my roommates smoke cigarettes both home and in the car, so I guess they would be the ones getting their own and my secondhand smoke.

No one,  I live alone,  and now only smoke in my car,  alone.  My family doesn't know I smoke.

I play stupid mindless cell phone games.
Drink

Relaxing is the best stress reliever. I notice the older i get the harder it is to find alone time.
Rant and rave to other people
Relaxing and talking through stresss is the best
Relaxing and meditation.
What would you miss most if you quit smoking for good? #TDII
Honestly, nothing. I don't have any attachment to cigarettes
Hi 10408 - sounds like there is nothing you would miss at all. What would you be happy to get rid of?
The stigma of smokers. and most of all the Harsh effect on the body. Johannes Thrul

Soon*

Thanks! I'm taking steps , it's a process for sure. Johannes Thrul

45. Remember that small step towards quitting you chose 2 weeks ago? Try out a different one and tell the group how it worked out for you. #freeyourself • Delay your first cigarette of the day by 10 minutes• Limit your smoking to one or two places only• Smoke fewer cigarettes each day• Quit smoking for 24 hours
I've only had 2 cigarettes in like the last 2 weeks
I'll try smoking fewer cigarettes each day.
Limit smoking to only one or two places
I've honestly been chain smoking for the past week or so because I've been in environments where smoking is allowed and I can just whip out a cigarette whenever need be.

10327, have you thought about vaping? I've cut down from half a carton a day, to only 2 cigarettes a day. Granted, I'm puffing on my vape constantly, but it tastes better, I don't smell like smoke, it's cheaper beyond belief, and I feel like I'm breathing better! And 10378! Congrats on cutting back so far! :) And everyone else, I know that most of us are in this group for the pocket change, but I kind of wish we had a little more conversation going, if it's just me, I'll shut up, but I was really looking forward to a community for sharing tips, victories, and setbacks. I'm really looking forward to quitting, but I'm currently lacking support in my life. Does anyone else feel the same way?
I love to vape but I financially can't afford for another two months or so because I just moved, so I feel like I'm stuckm

Oh bless your heart!  I understand completely! They do have starter kits for relatively cheap, and then you can upgrade later. That's what I'm doing, because I wasn't sure if I'd enjoy vaping, but I love it too! I hope you find something to help you cut back in the meantime :)
I delayed my cigarette by a few house and it's worked good. almost there
44.  What are some of your favorite qualities about yourself? How does smoking fit (or not fit) with that image of you? #balance
I am free spirited, yet smoking has never affected my personality.
I don't care what other people think of me. Smoking doesn't effect that.
I'm really laid back and don't let shit get to me. And I'm super trustworthy and honest. Smoking has nothing to do with that.
I love to make other people happy, and smoking has never had anything to do with that.
I'm very laid back and easy going. Smoking doesn't help with public image.

I like to think that I'm professional, and humorous, and quite the flirtatious southern red head momma made me to be, I can see how smoking would be a turn off, and I think I'd be willing to quit for the right person.
I don't think smoking affects my best qualities-hard working, loyal, fun, compassionate.

data.message: 43.  Many states and organizations are releasing anti-tobacco media campaigns, like this one from the CDC. How you feel about these ads being made public on television and billboards? #smokingaffectsall
data.name: Amanda's Story - Tips From Former Smokers
data.caption: www.cdc.gov
data.description: Amanda smoked during pregnancy and her baby was born two months early. Her full story and her videos are part of CDC's Tips From Former Smokers campaign.

data.message: I think these are ridiculous. Everyone who smokes knows how dangerous it is. Everyone who doesn't smoke knows how dangerous it is.
I don't think anyone is ignorant enough to not know that smoking is unhealthy.
I think it's good for people that don't know the dangers of cigarettes. Maybe children or young adults.

I think a lot of times we don't think about how much smoking can be harmful to everyone because it often causes chronic health problems rather than acute problems. I think these media campaigns force people to think about the dangers in a way that's uncomfortable. Whether it will be effective or not, we'll see...
Good intentions, but poorly played out.

The ads from CDC have literally scared me. But it didn't scare me into the point of not wanting to smoke anymore. It scares me because these corporations are trying to block young adults from free reign.

41.  Think about when, where, and why you choose to smoke when you do. Do those situations have in anything common? Pick one of the following situations (or tell us your own) and tell us why that circumstance almost always ends with a cigarette for you. #beingconscious • When you’re drinking coffee• When you’re driving• When you’re drinking alcohol• When you’re talking on the phone• When you’re feeling down
I started smoking to help deal with anxiety. Almost every time I have a panic attack I wind up having one because it calms me down almost instantly.
Being stuck in traffic always makes me fidgety and crave a cigarette.
Driving!!!!!
Driving is definitely a big part of my smoking, and also just being bored.
I smoke in all of those scenarios. I just like smoking and I do it a lot.
I smoke in all of those scenarios, especially during times of high stress.
When I'm drinking or driving for sure.
42.  Has smoking changed the way you view yourself? What is your self-identity as someone who smokes? #knowyourself
I don't really tie in smoking to my identity.
I smoke but I'm more than just a smoker. It doesn't change anything about me, except that I like to have cigarettes.
I dissapoint myself,  but it doesn't change who I am.
I smoke but that doesn't define who I am, my habits don't define who I am.
There is no connection between who I am and smoking.
It doesn't have anything to do with who I am.
It is different. I think people look at smokers different and sometimes take it bad.
40.  How do you think your home environment would change if you quit smoking? #beingconscious
I would have more money to decorate my home, I guess? I don't know how many butts I've tossed but I guess somewhere around A LOT.
I wouldn't have to have a smokers pott  next to my door....
I have thrown out prolly every other cigarette butt I've smoked since I started smoking.
Wouldn't have an ashtray on the porch..
Wouldn't have so many ashtrays

39.  Children can’t really distinguish between vapor and smoke. What they see are important adults in their life setting an example for how to take care of themselves, what they spend their money on, and their attitudes about addictive substances. Would you hide your e-cig smoking from a child? #ecig
I hide it from my sisters every weekend
Idk, they're gonna see people smoking. It's a part of life that is fairly common and can't be hidden for long.

I would not hide my e-cigarette from a child because it is not hurting them. Smoking will always be a part of society, and children are going to learn sooner than later that there are clean ways of smoking and there are polluted and corrupted ways, but they have a choice, regardless.
I don't use them. I just don't smoke around kids.
I wouldn't HIDE it but I wouldn't do it around them.
Yes I would. I don't smoke around kids so I wouldn't vape either.
37.  With all the new Tobacco Legislation, most workplaces are now smoke-free. Do you think it's better for society as a whole to have smoke-free workplaces? #smokingaffectsall

Yes,  inside workplaces, because you don't want someone held against their will in a smoke filled room.  However I don't believe they should keep them from smoking in designated smoking areas.  It's a personal decision to smoke,  and it shouldn't be controlled by a company.  Obviously they just want to eradicate smoke breaks,  in the hopes of raising productivity.
Smoking in designated areas should be allowed. You work for wherever, they don't own you.
No, i think its ridiculous because there is a higher percentage of workers who do smoke than don't smoke, and the government is regulating hard workers.

I think you should be allowed to smoke in designated outside areas. I understand not smoking inside as a sign of respect for nonsmokers, but if I want to clock off and go outside to smoke I should be able too.
I agree that smoking should be allowed in designated outdoor areas.
I think there should be designated smoking areas outside. People will find a way to smoke regardless.
38.  What have you heard about the patch, a form of Nicotine Replacement Therapy? Would you ever use it? #beingconscious
No because I'm allergic to anything that sticks to me.
No, I don't think the nicotine is nearly as important to me as the physical aspect of smoking.
I agree with 10450,  I think it's the act of smoking,  not the nicotine.
The patch is the most absurd thing I've heard of. I will never try it. A band-aid will not fix my smoking addiction.
The patch is the most absurd thing I've heard of. I will never try it. A band-aid will not fix my smoking addiction.
I've tried the patch but I had a very strong reaction to it and was told to never use it again.
I've never tried the patch, but I also never plan to do so. Just doesn't seem like a good alternative.
Today, I wanted to ask you about smoking and alcohol use. Is there a connection between the two in your personal experience? #TDII

data.message: 36.  Check out how one Tobacco company called young adult smokers "replacement smokers" on record. What does it feel like to be part of a big, expensive marketing strategy? #reflection
It feels just like literally every other day. We're all just consumers to corporations and not actually people.
Crappy feeling to be a statistic that keeps a big harmful corporation in business.
It makes me feel like I am part of a advertising conspiracy
Makes me feel like a target demographic.
It's just like with any other corporation. The goal is always to market and sell as much as possible.
35.  When you read this statistic, who in your life do you start thinking about? Friends, family, coworkers? #smokingaffectsall

I really try to avoid smoking around anyone but I guess if anyone it would be my kids from second hand smoke on my clothing and maybe a few non-smoking friends who are around me occasionally while smoking
I think about anyone I'm around. I try not to smoke around anyone.
Everyone who I'm around, coworkers and friends.
My friends mostly. But a lot of them smoke anyways.
Can dogs get problems from it?  If so,  my dogs.
34.  Let's see how many comebacks you guys can come up with for this ever-popular drawback to quitting. What will you tell yourself if this thought crosses your mind? #balance
I don't care about gaining weight.
Tobacco doesn't have that many calories.
Quitting smoking is usually done to be healthier, and a healthy diet and exercise is just as important to good health as not smoking is.
But I'll be able to breathe easier, which will make exercise easier.
But my lungs will be healthier so I can exercise more.
Don't smoke while you walk 10435, bam!

33.  Social situations can make it hard to not smoke, especially when alcohol is involved. Does alcohol affect your smoking? How would you change that if you wanted to cut down or quit? #beingconscious
It totally does. I've more or less stopped drinking though. I only drink at parties and such now.
I definitely smoke a lot more when I drink but I don't drink very much as it is, every other week I'll have a few drinks and that's about it so I doubt I'd change that habit.
Yes it does. I think i would cut back on drinking to help quit smoking. It would definitely help.
Alcohol is definitely a factor when it comes to smoking. The more I drink, the more I smoke. I don't really drink anymore so drinking and smoking and how it affects me isn't really a factor
Alcohol totally makes me want to smoke,  but I think I can just leave my pack in the car to not cut back
Alcohol definitely increases my smoking. But I won't be drinking over the next month due to surgery so hopefully it will be easier to quit.
I smoke a lot more if I've been drinking than I would sober.

32.  It’s not just your friends and family who may want you to quit! The Surgeon General’s office, the Center for Disease Control (CDC), and other national organizations are urging people to quit smoking. How does it feel to see our society moving towards a tobacco-free mindset? #smokingaffectsall
I feel like people should be able to make thier own decisions about themselves without judgment.
I feel like they do it to win votes/funding,  not because they care.

I feel as though it because of a need for more healthy propaganda that our society is moving towards a tobacoo-free mindset. Our society is gearing towards helathier choices for ourselves simply because the tobacco companies are coming under fire for losing lives instead of saving lives for our society. think about it. Think about all of the advertisements you see now for smoking cessation, especially for young adults. Didn't it used to be that all we saw was advertisements for actual cigarettes?
Overall, I think it's good for the world and society to be tobacco Free, but I also feel it should be up to the individual on whether they want to quit and when.
I think there are a lot of double standards when it comes to smoker shaming.
It's a good step in the right direction. Also a big change on how it was in the old days.
I think it's a good thing, but also agree that it should be the person's choice to quit
Do you think you will EVER be ready to quit smoking? Why? Why not? #TDII
Yes I will, because I think it's a lot mental and I've been able to quit other addictions similar to smoking cigarettes.
Hi 10408 - that sounds great! When will you be ready?
I need to go to Wal-Mart and look at the nicotine replacement gum. I think that will be my help.
I think that's a great plan 10408! When will you go to Wal-Mart? Have you though about calling the quit line for some free nicotine replacement at all?
I didn't know that had trials through a quit line Johannes Thrul That's great information! Thanks Doc
Not sure if every state has it, but you can find out online - just google "your state" and "quitline". Let me know what you find out 10408!
Alright sounds good! Johannes Thrul
I called them, but it was a long process Johannes Thrul I'll call back tomorrow
Sorry to hear that 10408 - keep me posted if it works out and let me know if I can help!
Yes for sure, thanks a bunch!
Sure you're welcome 10408! I'll check back with you next week.
31. Turn it up a notch. Tell someone special about the small step you tried yesterday. How did it go? #freeyourself
I actually finished my pack at work yesterday and haven't bought another pack yet. I mentioned it to my girlfriend, it was good. ^_^
Told my doctor about how I've limited myself to 3 cigarettes or less a day and she's thrilled.
I've been sharing my thoughts and plans with my coworkers, and they stopped me from taking a smoke break this afternoon. I'm so very thankful to have them!
They were very supportive, it was my co workers. I cut back a few cigs today .

Well I finished my pack of cigarettes last night before I went to work and this morning I bought another pack, simply because I'm in that much stress. The fact that a pack lasted me a day is phenomenal in my eyes because I used to go through two packs a day at least. I'm going to see how long this pack will last me today. Really, I'm just waiting to have enough money to buy an ecigarette.
I told a couple coworkers I want to cut back. They're supportive.
I told my boyfriend, he was supportive.

30.  Baby steps are required to conquer smoking once and for all. Pick one of these small steps to try and post your choice here. #freeyourself • Smoke five fewer cigarettes each day• Delay your first cigarette of the day by 10 minutes• Limit your smoking to one or two places only• Quit smoking for 24-hours
Smoke 5 fewer cigs each day. That sounds best to me
Smoke five fewer, only smoke one on my way to and from work,  don't smoke before bed,  skip the afternoon smoke break,  and...I'll have to watch myself to see where I can cut that 5th one out...
I am going to delay smoking cigarettes to my house only. That way I can only smoke cigarettes at work, which means that if we are busy, I would have to not smoke a cigarette, lol.
I only smoke at work.
5 fewer cigs a day, I guess? Slowly weaning sounds best.
Smoking five fewer per day sounds like the best route for me to take.
I've limited myself to smoking at work. I don't bring my cigarettes home. And I'm often too busy to smoke which cut me down to 3 cigarettes or less a day.

data.message: 29.  Hoping to be prepared for withdrawal symptoms? Learn about what to expect at the link below. How are you planning to deal with these symptoms when you decide to quit? #balance http://smokefree.gov/withdrawal
Video games are a pretty good distraction.
Stop drinking coke!  For the weight gain :)
I will probably switch one bad habit to another habit. Gum helps me. Mind distraction.
I guess I would try and replace it with another healthier habit that would distract me.
I am going to make sure my body is healthy as possible. I am going to stick to using an e-cigarette at 0 nicotine and take it day by day.
I would try to distract myself in any way possible.

28.  In a survey of 800 New Yorkers: • 81% agreed that most people would not hire a smoker to take care of their children• 72% agreed that most non-smokers would be reluctant to date a smoker• 39% agreed that most people think less of a person who smokes• 21% agreed that most people think smoking is a sign of personal failureWhat do YOU really think of smokers when you see them on the street? #knowyourself
That we shouldn't judge them. You don't know thier story.
Most non smokers wouldn't date a person who smokes.
I don't think anything. They're human just like I and everyone else.
Their life,  not mine.
I don't think anything of it when I see someone smoking. But working in the medical field, I always feel a bit embarrassed if one of my doctors sees me smoking.
I'm not a judgmental prick so I don't think negatively of anyone just because they smoke.

I don't think anything smokers on the street because everyone is entitled to their own beliefs, thoughts and habits, regardless of who sees you or why they think. Just because I'm trying to quit smoking doesn't mean I'm going to shun everyone who smokes or expect everyone to stop smoking with me.
27.  If you want to get info about how to quit smoking, where do you go? How do you know the source is true? #beingconscious
I usually go on a government funded site with ".gov" after the website. That's helps me feel reassured that it's all accurate information.
A government website because false information is illegal to put on a website. Also, anything that has to fo with legitimate health care as well.

I usually go to medically backed websites from teaching institutes (Johns Hopkins, Mayo Clinic) and government funded (FDA, etc). Anything that lists several references that I can double check for credibility.
I never really look up information about how to quit but I've seen commercials on television advertising help for people who want to quit.
I've never really looked up information on how to quit.
Usually just using government funded websites.

26.  Studies of former smokers show that it is extremely helpful to know where, when, and why you are most likely to smoke. That way, when you’re quitting your habit, you can plan ahead for those situations and won’t be caught off guard. Which situation are you most likely to smoke in? #beingconscious • When you first wake up in the morning• When you’re stressed• When you’re socializing with friends• When you’re tired• When you’re in a bad mood
At work, when drinking, when having a panic attack, before and after riding the train
Anger, Traffic, and having a very large meal seem to be the big triggers for me.
When I first wake up and when I'm bored are when I smoke the most
Pretty much all of those listed except when I'm tired. I hate smoking when I'm tired. But I smoke a lot when I'm drinking and always have to have one after eating.
Whenever I'm stressed. Mostly at work. And working at a smoke shop doesn't help.
Stress,  and driving.  I really only smoke when I drive,  or deal with a rude customer
Stress

Hi everyone! If you haven't seen it yet, PLEASE read the post i pinned to the top of this group. On mobile, you may have to click the part that says "view pinned posts". This post is for you to make sure you understand that if you only comment on 6 out of 7 days a week, I can't count that week for you! Hopefully that answers some of your questions on how these incentives work. Also, if you comment on a post after I've already liked it, it's too late for that post because that means I've already checked it for comments!Thanks everyone,Victoria from TSP

23.  Breathing and relaxation techniques can be really helpful when you quit and enrich your daily life. Here’s a link describing a few different techniques -- try one out and tell us how it went. Which one works best for you? #feelinghealthy
I'm going to finish off my pack tonight and attempt to go cold turkey.  These will be a great help!
I can't see the link ><
Neither can i...I was so excited about trying them out,  but then I tried to find them and I couldn't. ..
Oh okay it's not just me then haha
Do you think they actually read the comments?  Or just tally at the end of the week to see who gets paid?  We might never know these amazing breathing techniques...
I do not know
Tsp Study, could you edit your post to add the link?
I always make sure to do something outside. I love being in the outdoors and breathing fresh air, its the best feeling in the world. Especially when you don't have cigarettes lol.
I still can't see the link, but breathing techniques have always helped me keep my temper in check.
No link. But I want to do nicotine replacement therapy.
I also don't see a link.

I've heard that when people have a strong urge to smoke when they're stressed so that they calm down, the smoking calms them because the breathing technique used during smoking a cigarette is very similar to a meditation breathing technique used for certain martial arts. I've actually tried sucking/nomming on a pen when having an urge to smoke (when I had no access to cigarettes) and it helped with the urge.
Hi everyone, so sorry for the wait! Here's the link http://quitsmoking.about.com/od/cravingsandurges/a/deepbreaths.htm - Victoria from TSP

25.  Take a few deep breaths to center yourself the next time your cravings are getting to you. Try it out today and tell us how it went. Were you able to put off lighting up for a little while? #feelinghealthy
I haven't had one in like 2 days now because I haven't been at work.
Today was a stressful day so it was really hard to just relax and try to take a deep breath without wanting a cigarette. But I did it and I'm glad I did
Yes I was. It wasn't to bad. Good to relax
Yeah I was able to not light up. If I consciously think about not smoking I can avoid it.
It helped me for a little while.

24.  Big Tobacco is advertising e-cigarettes as a safer and better way to smoke, but studies have shown that they still contain toxins. Why do you think so many people are ready to adopt them even before proper research has been conducted? #ecig http://tobaccocontrol.bmj.com/content/early/2013/03/05/tobaccocontrol-2012-050859.abstract?papetoc
Because people still want thier nicotine without feeling gulity.

People are always ready to jump on bandwagons before they research more. Just another thing to spend your money on. Majority of people I know have bought the e-cigs and then went back to cigs so they basically paid for something that's a waste
I agree with the bandwagon statement.  It's like more socially acceptable than smoking is now, and smoker shaming is everywhere, but if you say "oh it's just a e-cig" nobody gives a shit.
Less fire hazard, you don't smell of smoke,  and it comes in different flavors.
People tend to think it's less harmful because it logically doesn't contain nearly the number of toxins found in cigarettes.
I think a lot of it is the bandwagon effect .

E cigarettes are the smartest alternative to cigarettes and to the consumer, it is the least expensive. No one really cares about FDA approvals and whatnot for products that do the job. It's all about the quality of the product, not the ethics of a product, in this case.

E cigarettes are the smartest alternative to cigarettes and to the consumer, it is the least expensive. No one really cares about FDA approvals and whatnot for products that do the job. It's all about the quality of the product, not the ethics of a product, in this case.
Have you ever noticed a connection between smoking and your mood? Is there an emotional state that gets you to light up more frequently? #TDII
At work,  I use it to step away after dealing with a particularly difficult rush or rude customer.  It gives me an excuse to step away and be alone for a moment.
Thanks for sharing 10435 - yes these sound like situations that can make it difficult not to smoke. Have you ever tried alternatives to smoking that would help in these situations? How did it go?

I tried to step in the back, just breath for a few mins, grab a drink, but then I'd get  told to get back to work by an angry manager,  which would just piss me off more,  so then I'd go outside for a smoke. I think that's one of the honest reasons I started, because it seems like smokers get way more breaks because of their habit.
That sounds reasonable 10435 - breaks at work can be nice. I wonder if there is a way to step outside, take a break, but not smoke? Have you ever tried that? What else could work for you?

Admittedly I have yet to just step outside without smoking, in the fear of a manager commenting on it, saying "you're not smoking, you don't need to be out here." I've considered vaping, but I feel that some of the Facebook posts on here saying they are just as bad as regular cigarettes, and shouldn't be used as a crutch to help you quit.

10435 - the thing with e-cigs/vapes is that we simply don't know enough about them yet, so they may still be a health risk and I cannot recommend them 100%. Have you ever thought about nicotine replacement at all?
Sorry I've got to run. See you next week!

22.  It's no shock that tobacco companies spend loads of time and money thinking of how to appeal to a younger crowd with fresher lungs. Check out this document, straight from a major tobacco company. How does it feel to be targeted by a huge, expensive marketing campaign? #beingconscious http://www.legacy.library.ucsf.edu/tid/swx83d00/pdf?search=%%2022508783540%22
Its not good. But I never felt like I was bring targeted. It was more of a choice and doing something "wrong" when you're young is cool.
All big corporations are sleazy. It's not just big tabacco.

Big corporations are automated corruptions, vying for the attention of their targets. In this case, big tobacco companies target young adults in their ad campaigns and make us feel as if we are smothered in smoke, even though we haven't even bought a pack of cigarettes yet.

Target marketing is everywhere though, in every business. Just like McDonald's targeting kids with happy meals and play places to get them hooked on fast food for life, which is also insanely unhealthy. It's nothing new to me that I'm part of a demographic that is targeted by people making money. I don't have any feelings on it, because at the end of the day they're all out to make as much money as possible and it's a hell of a better idea for them to try and hook a 15-20 year old with 60 years left in them than a 60 year old with not much life left.
Big brother is watching...
Big tobacco isn't nearly as bad as some of the companies for things like prescription drugs and unhealthy foods. Everywhere we hear how bad tobacco is, but never how terrible mcdonalds is.
